attributes.action: Ban the use of Nestlé products in all government departments until they comply with WHO recommendations on their marketing practices
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The actions Nestlé in marketing their artificial baby milk is partly responsible for the deaths of around 1.5 million babies world wide each year.  The reason for this is the fact that according to UNICEF, "Marketing practices that undermine breastfeeding are potentially hazardous wherever they are pursued: in the developing world, WHO estimates that some 1.5 million children die each year because they are not adequately breastfed. These facts are not in dispute."

The best solution to this problem would be for the UK government to ban the sale of Nestlé products in the UK until their marketing practices are amended, but as a gesture, we would like to see a ban on the use of Nestlé products in government departments in order to send a small sign of government discontent on this issue.
